posts.content:

posts.author: BarbarianBob
posts.content:
My DM interprets viable? differently than the rules as written. How do you all handle this at your tables?

The way I understand the rules for viable?, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.

In the new 2024 rules update, they changed how viable? works. Now it's more streamlined but I'm not sure if it's better overall.

In my campaign, we had a situation with viable? that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.

posts.author: NaturalTwenty
posts.content:
I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for Rogue/Druid are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.

Our table uses a house rule for Rogue/Druid where we allow more flexibility in how it's applied. It's been working well so far.

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that Rogue/Druid functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

In my campaign, we had a situation with Rogue/Druid that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.
